articles.description: RIDDLE — It’s not uncommon for people looking for guidance in life to say they’ve had an epiphany, some kind of message or sign from a higher power that gives them direction. For 80-year-old Willie Schmidt, that epiphany came at…
articles.title: Painting hand in hand with God: The life and art of Willie Schmidt

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: Oregon Senator Ron Wyden joined News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN News Director Kyle Bailey in the studio Monday, answering questions and asking for opinions of events happening in Washington D.C. which affect Douglas County.
articles.title: Q&A with Sen. Ron Wyden

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Douglas County’s seasonally adjusted payroll employment decreased by 230 jobs in July after an increase of 160 in June and 90 in May.
articles.title: Douglas County employers drop 230 jobs in July

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Roseburg's Stewart Park Bridge has stood as a shortcut across the South Umpqua River for commercial and residential travelers since 1933. However, as the years have gone on, the bridge has become worn and aged, with its paint beginning to…
articles.title: Stewart Park Bridge construction making progress, nearing late fall completion

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: Each year, the U.S. Health Resources & Services Administration (HRSA) recognizes growth and improvement in health care providers through the awarding of Community Health Quality Recognition (CHQR) badges.
articles.title: Adapt Integrated Health Care receives multiple awards for healthcare quality

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: DRAIN — The 103rd North Douglas County Fair will be held Friday and Saturday at the Drain Civic Center, 241 S. First Street in Drain.
articles.title: North Douglas County Fair brings fun for all

articles.author: Erica Reynolds The News-Review
articles.description: REEDSPORT — Coos Forest Protective Association issued a final update on the Scholfield Ridge Fire at 8:30 p.m. Monday, stating the fire was still held at 50 acres and was 57% contained.
articles.title: Final update issued in Scholfield Ridge Fire

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: OREGON — Fishing for Chinook salmon, both hatchery and wild, has closed on the Umpqua, Smith and North Fork Smith rivers because the quota of 500 wild fall Chinook has been reached.
articles.title: Umpqua, Smith, North Fork Smith Rivers fishery is closed

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Almost a week of above normal temperatures is coming to the Umpqua Valley, with the potential for near record highs starting later in the week.
articles.title: Above normal temperatures coming, near record highs possible

articles.author: Amelia Winkelman The News-Review
articles.description: Riding a bike on Diamond Lake Boulevard is not an easy — or safe — task. Take it from Thomas Guevara, Oregon Department of Transportation’s senior transportation planner and project manager, who used to ride his bike there.
articles.title: Community conversation about Diamond Lake Boulevard improvements

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: GREEN DISTRICT — Earlier this spring, things were looking up for Volante of Roseburg, an upscale assisted living and memory care facility operated by Volante Senior Living (VSL) at 100 Winery Lane in Roseburg, near Winston.
articles.title: Future of Volante of Roseburg unclear construction comes to halt, lawsuits

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: WINSTON — On Monday, the Winston City Council held a meeting in which it discussed two major ordinances. By the end of the meeting, the council decided to table an ordinance for limiting the length of stay at RV parks…
articles.title: Winston City Council passes motion to allow marijuana dispensaries, tables ordinance for RV Parks Code

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Stephanie Svinning walked out of the Back to School Bash on the Roseburg High School campus with way more items then she arrived with.
articles.title: Back to School Bash gets children ready for school

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Drain man was sentenced for illegally manufacturing firearms with a 3D printer. David Ralston, 35, pleaded guilty to three felony counts. He received probation, jail time served, and forfeited multiple firearms and parts.
articles.title: Drain Man Sentenced for Firearm Manufacturing Convictions

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police seized 16 dogs, firearms, and ammunition after an investigation into an alleged illegal breeding operation. A 66-year-old man faces 17 counts of animal neglect and firearm charges following the Aug. 18 incident.
articles.title: Police Seize Dogs, Firearms in Roseburg Animal Neglect Case

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: August 20, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Jonathan Dowdy of Coos Bay pleaded guilty to multiple charges in the April crash that killed UCC coach Jami Strinz and player Kiley Jones and injured eight others. Several counts were dismissed in a plea deal. Sentencing in Coquille is set for Sept. 11.
articles.title: Coos Bay Driver Pleads Guilty in UCC Softball Bus Crash

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Winston City Council tabled a proposal to limit RV park stays and advanced Ordinance 75-724, which includes zoning and animal code updates and would allow recreational marijuana facilities in the city. The measure proceeds to further review and public input.
articles.title: Winston Council Passes Marijuana Facility Ordinance, Tables RV Park Stay Limits

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Douglas County is gearing up for its 3rd Annual International Overdose Awareness Day event on Saturday, Aug. 23, from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Stewart Park Pavilion.
articles.title: Adapt Integrated Health Care, community partners to host overdose awareness event

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Roseburg Public Library is seeking input from patrons to guide their collection development. They are focusing on expanding digital materials and large-print books.
articles.title: Roseburg library seeks public's input on book collection choices

articles.description: An animal welfare investigation led to the discovery of an illegal dog breeding operation in Roseburg on Monday, according to the Roseburg Police Department.
